borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The bulk, mass, scale and siting of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearing and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers, particularly no.11 St John's Road. The proposed extension sits on the shared boundary and introduces a mass and bulk which generates an overbearing impact upon the amenity of no.11, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

The bulk, mass, scale and siting of the proposed development presents as an insubordinate addition to the dwelling which does not sympathise with the built form of the dwelling, the terrace and the wider area. The extension would impact the symmetry of the terrace and would introduce a mass and bulk to the rear and side which is uncharacteristic for the surrounding area. The proposal matches the footprint of the original dwelling and presents as an disproportionate addition.  As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)

- Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension and alterations to the first floor fenestration on the rear elevation to accommodate a Juliette balcony
